property.name: RowCount
property.description:
Type: "N",
Mode: "R",
Default = 0. The number of rows in the result set. -1 If not known. Do not rely on this value, as not all drivers support it. Walk the ResultSet with ::NextRow() instead.

property.name: CurrentRowIndex
property.description:
Type: "N",
Mode: "R",
Default = 0. The number of the current row.

property.name: CurrentRow
property.description:
Type: "SQL::Row",
Mode: "R",
Returns the current row as an object.

property.name: ColumnInfo
property.description:
Type: "P",
Mode: "R",
An array of SQL::DataTypeInfo column descriptions.

property.name: ColumnCount
property.description:
Type: "N",
Mode: "R",
Default = 0. The number of columns in the result set.

property.name: CallResult
property.description:
Type: "SQL::CallResult",
Mode: "R",
Detailed status of the result of the call.

property.name: TableInfo
property.description:
Type: "P",
Mode: "R",
Not always available. An array of SQL::TableInfo table descriptions returned by the query.

property.name: TableInfoCount
property.description:
Type: "N",
Mode: "R",
Default = 0. The number of elements in .TableInfo.

property.name: DBFRowSyntax
property.description:
Type: "C",
Mode: "R",
Default = "". The syntax required to create an Alpha Anywhere .DBF table with the same columns.

methodref.name: NextRow
NextRow
methodref.description: Position to the next row in the ResultSet.

methodref.name: ColumnNumber
methodref.description: Get the number of the column named.

methodref.name: Data
methodref.description: Get the data for the column name or index specified.

methodref.name: DataAsGeography
methodref.description: Get the data for the column name or index specified as a Geography object.

methodref.name: DataIsNull
methodref.description: Determine whether a given element is Null.

description.p: Fetch a block of one or more rows into a local cache table.
Note: This function is an advanced user feature and requires some understanding of cacheing for SQL.

methodref.name: ToString
methodref.description: Copy the ResultSet to a string.

methodref.name: ToXML
methodref.description: Convert ResultSet an XML formatted string.

methodref.name: ToExcel
methodref.description: Convert ResultSet to an Excel 2003 format (.xls) or 2007 format (.xlsx) file.

methodref.name: ToJSON
methodref.description: Convert a ResultSet to a JSON formatted string.

methodref.name: ToJSONObjectSyntax
methodref.description: Convert a ResultSet to JSON object syntax.

description.p: Fetch data from a result set to an open .DBF table
1. If MapByPosition is false (the default) only column names in the result set that match a local table column will be copied.
2. The column types in the result set must match the respective column in the local table.

methodref.name: ToDBF
methodref.description: Create a local copy of the result set in a .DBF table

methodref.name: GoToRow
methodref.description: Position to the row requested (Note: Backward movement is not supported by all databases).

methodref.name: ToPropertyArray
methodref.description: Convert the ResultSet to a property array.

methodref.name: ToGridComponentDataObject
methodref.description: Convert the ResultSet to a Grid Component DataObject data and field arrays.

methodref.name: NextResult
methodref.description: Position to the next set of rows in the ResultSet (applies only when multiple results are returned).

methodref.name: ToTableInfo
methodref.description: Return the column definitions as a single SQL::TableInfo.

methodref.name: FormatData
methodref.description: Format the data for the column name, index or definition specified.

methodref.name: ToFormattedString
methodref.description: Copy the ResultSet to a string.

methodref.name: ToCSV
methodref.description: Convert a ResultSet to Comma Separated Variable format.

methodref.name: ExecutePostProcess
methodref.description: Execute portable SQL against a resultset as P.

methodref.name: ToJSONFile
methodref.description: Convert a ResultSet to JSON object and store in TargetFile.

link.href: More about the SQL ResultSet Object.xml

links.link: More about the SQL ResultSet Object
